com.inrix.sdk

Class RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inrix.sdk.RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Enclosing class:
    RouteManager

    public static final class RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    Contains options that specify what route information to retrieve.
    See Also:
    RouteManager.requestRoutes(RequestRouteOptions, IRouteResponseListener)

        start - The route starting location.
        end - The route ending location.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - Thrown when
        • start is invalid.
        • end is invalid.

      • RequestRouteOptions

        public RequestRouteOptions(SavedTrip savedTrip)
        Initializes a new instance of RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions using the supplied trip.
        Parameters:
        savedTrip - The trip that a route will be requested for.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - Thrown when
        • savedTrip is invalid.
        • savedTrip has invalid origin. See: SavedTrip.getOrigin().
        • savedTrip has invalid destination. See: SavedTrip.getDestination().
        • savedTrip has one or more invalid waypoints.See: SavedTrip.getWaypoints().

      • setWaypoints

        public RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions setWaypoints(List<GeoPoint> waypoints)
        Sets the optional waypoints, which are points that the route will go through in between the start and end points.

        The maximum number of waypoints is 8.

        Parameters:
        waypoints - The route waypoints.
        Returns:
        This instance of the RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions class.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - when waypoints is null, is empty, contains invalid waypoints or too many waypoints 8.

      • setHeading

        public RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions setHeading(Integer heading)
        Sets the heading, which is direction the user is going. Having information on the user's current heading assists routing engine in choosing the best routes.
        Parameters:
        heading - The heading value in degrees. Accepted range is 0 to 360, where 0 degrees is North.
        Returns:
        This instance of the RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions class.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - when the heading is out of range.

      • setNumAlternates

        public RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions setNumAlternates(int numAlternates)
        Sets the number of alternate routes to be calculated.

        By default, only one route is returned, but you can request up to two alternates. If all of the routes have closures and cannot be driven, the third route returned is replaced with a fastest traffic-aware route that is navigable. In other words, no matter what the conditions are on the primary (and possibly secondary) routes, the API always returns at least one navigable route.

        Parameters:
        numAlternates - The number of alternate routes to request.
        Returns:
        This instance of the RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions class.

      • setCollapseManeuver

        public RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions setCollapseManeuver(boolean collapseManeuver)
        Set the flag to collapse the maneuvers of this route response.
        Parameters:
        collapseManeuver - true to collapse the maneuvers, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        This instance of the RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions class.

      • setCriteria

        public RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions setCriteria(int criteria)
        Set the criteria for this route find request. This is a bit field that can be combined to specify various criteria

        See:

        • RouteManager.ROUTE_CRITERIA_NO_RESTRICTIONS
        • RouteManager.ROUTE_CRITERIA_AVOID_FERRIES
        • RouteManager.ROUTE_CRITERIA_AVOID_HIGHWAYS
        • RouteManager.ROUTE_CRITERIA_AVOID_TOLL_ROADS
        • RouteManager.ROUTE_CRITERIA_AVOID_VIGNETTE
        Parameters:
        criteria - - number containing the route find criteria.
        Returns:
        This instance of the RouteManager.RequestRouteOptions class.

      • setTolerance

        public final T setTolerance(int tolerance)
        Sets the tolerance, which affects the number of latitude/longitude points returned.

        The tolerance value should be greater than or equal to 0 and is specified in yards for English units and meters for metric units. The default is 0, which means exact (no inaccuracy is tolerated), and results in all possible points being returned. Higher values will reduce the number of points by eliminating points whose distance from each other is less than the specified tolerance. Based on the level of zoom used to draw the map, you can save bandwidth by reducing the size of the return payload. For example, if the map is zoomed to a 300-mile level, you may want to return fewer data points.

        Parameters:
        tolerance - The tolerance value in yards or meters, depending on the units set in the user preferences.
        Returns:
        This instance of the class.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - when tolerance is less than zero.

      • setSpeedBucketsEnabled

        public final T setSpeedBucketsEnabled(boolean enableSpeedBuckets)
        Enable or disable speed buckets in the request.
        Parameters:
        enableSpeedBuckets - true to enabled speed buckets, false otherwise
        Returns:
        This instance of the class.

      • setOutputFields

        public final T setOutputFields(int outputFields)
        Sets what route information should be returned.

        Fields can be combined. For instance, to return both basic description and waypoints, use ROUTE_OUTPUT_FIELD_DESCRIPTION | ROUTE_OUTPUT_FIELD_WAYPOINTS.

        Parameters:
        outputFields - Fields to return for route information.
        Returns:
        This instance of the class.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - when outputFields is invalid.

      • setUnits

        public final T setUnits(UserPreferences.Unit units)
        Sets units explicitly for this route request. These units override the units set in the user preferences.
        Parameters:
        units - The units of this request.
        Returns:
        This instance of the class.
        Throws:
        RouteManager.RouteManagerException - Thrown when units is null.

      • setRouteRequestTime

        public final T setRouteRequestTime(RouteManager.RequestTime type,
                    Date time)
        Set the request time for the current route request.
        Parameters:
        type - An instance of enum RouteManager.RequestTime which denotes if the time is RouteManager.RequestTime.DEPARTURE_TIME or RouteManager.RequestTime.DEPARTURE_TIME. Note:- if the type is RouteManager.RequestTime.DEPARTURE_TIME and passed in a time in the past, then the requests get time stamped with the current time stamp.
        time - The time associated with the current route request.
        Returns:
        This instance of the class.

      • setUseTraffic

        public T setUseTraffic(boolean useTraffic)
        Set the flag to use or not use traffic while finding a route.
        Parameters:
        useTraffic - - if true traffic is considered while calculating the route - if false traffic is not considered.
        Returns:
        This instance of the class.
